intro: Verticordia sieberi var. lomata, commonly known as the Lomata featherflower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in heathland environments. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom during the cooler months. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is often found in coastal and inland regions of the southwest of Western Australia.
